string.text: Cosy place you have here.
아늑한 곳이군.
Damn right it is! Welcome to the Train Hangar, repurposed by yours truly into a humble hunting lodge. It's a safe place to unwind... for the most part.
당신의 이 오두막에 대해 좀 더 말해주겠어?

음, 간단히 말해서 여기는 사냥꾼을 위한 곳이야. 그놈들이 프로건 아마추어건 상관없어. 나를 위해 사냥을 해주는 사람들을 위해 보상을 주지. 네가 돌연변이들에게서 나온 어떤 것들이라도 나에게 준다면 보상을 후하게 쳐주지. 그리고 음식과 사냥에 필요한 것들을 아주 싸게 팔기도 해. 이 근처의 다른 상인들과는 다르게 내 열정을 다른 사람들과 나누는게 나에게는 제일 중요하거든. 어차피 돈벌이는 신경안썼어.
근처에 다른 사냥꾼들도 있나? 아니면 당신 뿐인가?

로스토크와 검은 계곡에서 온 사냥꾼들이 여기에 들리는 경향이 있지만 그놈들을 사이좋게 지내도록 하는건 항상 쉽지가 않아.\n \n그것 말고도, 여기에 내 친구들이 몇 명 있었어. 우리는 바깥 세상에서 모두 사냥 파트너였지, 알겠어? Gonta, Trapper, Fox... 모두 좋은 녀석들이었지. 우린 모두 Fox에게 제대로 된 장례식을 치러주기 위해 여기 왔지만 슬프게도 다른 두 명은 여기 머물 수 없었어. 들은 바에 의하면 북쪽의 스토커들이 내 친구들을 정말로 필요로 했다더군.
언제 한번 그 친구들을 만나러 가보도록 하지.
왜 flea market의 상인들과 보초들은 여기서 살지 않지? 내가 보기에 여기가 훨씬 더 안전하고 살기 좋은 것 같은데 말이지.

내가 무슨 생각하는지 알아? 내 생각에는 듀티의 높으신 분이 비밀리에 그놈들에게 돈을 주고 flea market에 앉아있으라고 하는 것 같아. 로스토크와 검은 계곡 사이의 상황을 감시하기 위한 스파이 같은 거지. 어쨋든, 그 상인놈들은 사냥정신을 가지고 있지 않아. 그놈들은 "사재기, 사재기, 사재기" 만 할 줄 알지! 그러니까 그 까치놈들이 여기 오지않는건 정말 다행이야.
당신은 아마 엄청난 수의 돌연변이들을 사냥했겠지. 그것과 관련해서 어떤 이야기라도 있어?

오, 좋은 게 하나 있지. 몇 년 전에 듀티를 도와서 돌연변이 둥지를 청소하는 일을 맡은 적 있지.
 
우리는 그저 Wild Territory에서 블러드서커, 폴터가이스트, 스노크들이 있는 구역을 정리했어. 그 당시 그 끔찍한 장소에는 그놈들이 득실댔어. 다행스럽게도 내 숙련된 능력으로 한번에 작은 무리들의 돌연변이들만 만나게 할 수 있었고, 우리는 그 괴물들을 하나씩 하나씩 잡아냈지.
 
아무튼, 나는 내 일을 잘 해냈지만 듀티는 밤이 될 때 까지 그 일을 계속해야 한다고 고집스럽게 주장했고, 그 다음날 바로 청소를 시작할 수 있게 캠프를 세워야한다고 했지. 그놈들은 "장군의 명령입니다." 라고 말했어. 흠. 우리는 대부분의 스토커들이 다니는 잘 닳은 길에서 꽤 멀리 떨어진 지역에 있었지만 그놈들은 신경도 쓰지 않는 것 같았어. 우리는 버려진 공사장의 폐허를 발견했고, 계단을 올라가서 미완공 된 꼭대기 층으로 간 다음에 캠프를 쳤지.
 
몇 시간이 흐르고, 난 뭔가를 포착했어. 우리 아래에 있는 한 마리의 투쉬카노였어. 그놈은 두 다리로 달리는 돌연변이 설치류에 지나지 않았어. 그 놈은 네 발보다도 크지 않아. 그 다음에 그놈은 공기를 들이 마시더니 갑자기 머리를 우리쪽으로 휙 휘두르고서는 피가 고이는 비명을 내지르는거야.
 
수백 수천개의 빌어먹을 그램린들이 파이프 땅 구멍, 그리고 다른 폐어에서 기어나오기 시작했고 곧장 우리쪽으로 우르르 몰려오기 시작했지
 
심지어 더 이상 바닥도 보이지 않을 지경이었지. 듀티 부대는 용감하게 싸웠지만, 빠르게 압도당했고, 그놈들의 엄청난 수에 눌려 비명을 질러보기도 전에 땅바닥에 쓰러졌지.
 
나는 좀전까지 내가 쉬고 있던 기둥으로 재빨리 기어올랐어. 나는 아래로 수류탄을 던지고 벅샷을 갈기기 시작했지. 심지어 그 새끼들이 내가 있는 곳으로 올라오거나 뛰어들 때는 칼까지 사용했지.
 
끊임없는 비명과 피와 죽음의 악취가 몇 시간동안 이어졌어. 동이 트자 나는 벌벌 떨고 있었고, 내 코트는 지독하게도 긁혔고, 내 피부는 엄청나게 물린 자국과 발톱 자국으로 교차되었지.
 
그 새끼들이 마침내 흥미를 잃고 오후 낮잠을 자러 갔을 때, 그제서야 나는 기둥 아래로 내려왔어. 내 듀티 동지들을 찾아봤지만 뼈조차도 남아 있지 않았지.
 
나는 그날 잃어버린 삶을 저주하며 지옥처럼 부서진 내 몸을 이끌고 로스토크로 걸어갔어. 나는 스포츠로써 사냥을 하고, 듀티는 지옥의 문 그 자체를 사냥해. 글쎄, 그놈들은 거기서 그놈들의 길을 찾겠지. 다음에는 그놈들과 같이 사냥하러 가지 않을거야.

오 이런, 개에 대해서 이야기해보자구. 아마 지금 존 사방에서 달리고 있는 짐승떼들을 본 적이 있을거야. 심이저 코돈의 루키들마저도 그놈들은 본 적이 있을테지.
 
이놈들이 애완동물이거나, 온순하게 되거나, 길들여질 수 있다는 생각은 집어치워버려. 존은 이 모든 짐승들을 건드렸어. 가까이서 존의 개들을 본 적이 있어? 그놈들은 눈이 멀었고 몇 세대 전에 시들어버린 눈을 가지고 있어.
 
날쌘 짐승들도 마찬가지야. 그놈들에게서 물린 상처는 네가 존에서 입을 수 있는 최악의 상처는 아니지만, 너를 느리게 하기에는 충분하고, 만약에 근처에 다른 짐승들이 있다면 너를 끝장내기에 충분하지.
 
무엇보다도, 그놈들의 후각은 그레이하운드보다 더 날카롭지.
 
이야기를 해달라고 했지만 무슨 얘기를 해야 할 지 모르겠어. 난 수백 명의 루키들과 심지어는 몇몇 경험 많은 스토커들이 이놈들을 과소평가하고 그 결과로 결국 갈기갈기 찢어지는 것을 봤지.
 
심지어는 군인들도 운이 없을 때가 있지. 최고의 갑옷이 의미하는게 뭔지 알아? 그건 개들이 너를 찢어놓는 대신에 피를 흘리게 한다는 거야.
 
하지만 대부분은 살덩이놈들을 사냥하는 것을 더 선호하니 근처에 개들이 먹을만큼의 야생식품이 있는 충분히 있는 한 넌 괜찮을거야. 어떤 경우에는, 내가 조용히 지나가기만 한다면 나를 그냥 보내주는 경우도 있어. 물론 너와 그놈들 사이에 이상현상이 있지 않는 이상 시도 해 볼 만한 일은 아니야. 그놈들이 조금 배가 고파지고 갑자기 마음을 바꾸게 된다면 그 결과는... 그걸 본 목격자만 불안해질 뿐이지.

이제, 모든 루키들과 그 할머니들은 존을 활보하는 개에 대해 들어봤지. 그렇지만 사칭개에 대해 들어본 적 있어?
 
존의 '일반적인' 개들이 사고 이후에 체르노빌을 집으로 삼은 개들의 자손인 반면, 사칭개들은 늑대가 그놈들의 선조지. 몇몇 사람들은 곰이나 심지어는 인간의 DNA도 섞여있다고 하지만, 나는 그건 아닌 것 같아.
 
어느 쪽이든, 허약한 개들이 못된 성질을 가지게 되는 대신에, 이건 개자식들이 좀 더 비열해진 경우라고 볼 수 있지. 많은 스토커들이 이 개가 단지 약간 납작하게 생긴 또 다른 개라고 생각하기 때문에 이놈들을 처음 만났을 때 죽거나 심하게 다치곤 하지.
 
사실말이지, 사칭개는 더 똑똑하고, 빠르고, 그리고 강력해. 그놈들 중 몇몇은 자기의 환영으로 만들어진 분신을 만들어 낼 수도 있어. 다른 어떤 놈들은 스토커들의 무기를 내리게 심리적으로 강요 할 수도 있지.
 
일반적인 존의 개들과는 달리 나는 스토커들이 이 야수들을 길들인다는 전설은 들어본 적이 있지만, 내 눈으로 직접 본 적은 없어. 늪지의 닥터가 한 마리 가지고 있다고 하지만, 몇 년 전에 닥터가 나를 치료 해줬을 때 그 사람 주변에 개가 돌아다니는 것은 기억이 나지 않아. 대신 그 소문은 비교적 최근의 것이지. 그 노인을 추적해서 언제 한번 찾아봐야 할까?

스노크에 대해 이야기 해 보자구. 그 이름은 그놈들이 쓰고 있는 마스크와 마스크를 통해서 내는 지옥같은 소리 때문에 붙여졌지.
 
으.. 그 역겹게 후루룩거리고 꿀꿀거리는 소리란..
 
어쨌든, 군대에서 존을 향해서 보낸 첫번째 원정대의 잔존이 바로 그놈들이라는 것이 일반적으로 알려져 있는 사실이야. 그놈들이 처음으로 보이기 시작한 것이 2007년 즈음이야, 한 군인놈이 수송을 기다리다가 한 놈에게 공격을 받았지. 돌아가서, 우리는 그놈들을 스노크가 아닌 "신병" 이라고 불러.
 
그놈들의 부패한 회색 몸통에 속아넘어가지 않도록 하라구. 그놈들의 근육은 말랐지만 강력하고, 먹이를 잡기 위해 공중으로 엄청난 거리를 도약할 수 있지. 스노크 한놈만 만나도 충분히 나쁜 상황이지만, 만약에 네가 준비되지 않은 채로 스노크 무리를 만난다면 당장의 고통을 덜어내고 바로 그 자리에서 도망치는 것이 나을 거야. 다행히도, 그놈들은 보통 지하에서만 발견돼. 글쎄. 내 말은 '보통' 말이지.
 
가장 큰 미스터리는 그놈들이 어떻게 번식하는가이지. 사냥꾼들이 몇 년 동안 그놈들을 도살하려고 노력했는데도 불구하고 어떻게 그놈들의 수가 그대로 유지되는걸까? 지나가던 과학자가 말하길 그놈들은 실제 사람의 잔해라기 보다는 사람을 본뜬 석고본같은 것 일 수 있다고 했는데, 난 도통 그게 무슨 말인지 모르겠더군.

아. 좀비, 좀비, 좀비. 좀비 본 적 있어? TV나 비디오게임에 나오는 뇌에 굶주린 시체들 말고 진짜 좀비 말이야.
 
어슬렁 거리며 돌아다니는 놈들이 여기 존에는 있어. 이 불쌍한 놈들 중 대부분은 정신파 이상현상에 끌려들었거나 듀가 방출장치 근처에 너무 오래 갇혔던 스토커들이지.
 
진정 불행한 것은 에미션이 불어 닥칠동안 숨을 곳을 찾지 못했을 경우 그놈들 같은 운명이 될 수도 있지. 네가 지금은 웃겠지만, 이건 농담이 아냐.
 
그놈들은 죽이는건 내 인생에서 최악의 사냥 경험 중 하나야. 좀비들을 사냥하는 것이 특별히 힘들어서가 아냐. 좀비들은 무기와 도구들을 사용 하는 법을 계속 기억하고 있지만, 그놈들은 느리고, 건망증에 걸린데다가 그렇게 빠르지도 않아. 좀비들이 최악인 이유는 우리가 그놈들 어딘가에 묻혀있는 인간의 껍질을 볼 수 있기 때문이지.
 
"병사여, 병사여! 도와줘, 나 여기 있어!"
 
"아티팩트 한개만, 아티팩트 한개만 더... 그러면 내 딸을 다시 볼 수 있을지도 몰라."
 
그런 것들이 내가 그놈들에게서 계속 듣는 거고, 나를 잠 못이루게 하지. 내가 자비롭다거나 한 것이 아냐, 좀비가 되는건 존에서 죽을 수 있는 방법 중에 가장 끔찍한 것같아, 알지?
 
몇몇 좀비들은 훨씬 더 늙어보이고 영화에서 볼 수 있는 것에 더 가까워보여.누더기말고는 옷이 없고, 손톱말고는 아무런 연장도 없어. 어떻게 그 지경까지 갔을까? 아마 그놈들은 일찍부터 살아남은 좀비 스토커들일거야. 아마 프리피얏 주민들의 시체일지도 모르지. 아니면, 한 과학자가 말했듯이 석고본에 불과할지도 모르지. 석고본이 뭐냐고 물었어? 내가 도대체 어떻게 알아.

잠깐 생각해보자구.
 
블러드서커와 마주친 적 있어? 그놈들은 크고, 포식적인 인간형 생물인데, 그놈들의 입이 있어야 할 곳에는 촉수가 뒤섞여있지. 그놈들을 엄청나게 사냥해왔지.
 
그놈들은 흡혈귀 같아. 그놈들은 사냥 할 때 은신을 하면서 오지. 심지어 백주 대낮에도 그놈들이 숨는다면 보이지가 않아. 너무 늦기 전에 블러드서커놈들을 감지하는 유일한 방법은 바로 그 엄청난 숨소리를 듣는거야. 일단 그놈들이 충분히 가까이 다가오면, 블러드서커놈들은 너를 팔로 감싼 다음 그 따뜻하고 촉촉한 촉수를 너의 맨살에 단단히 붙인 다음, 네가 마를 때 까지 빨아들일거야.
 
다른 수작은 부리지 말라구. 블러드서커의 몸은 거칠고, 종종 썩어있고, 니가 죽기 전까지 계속 너를 빨아들일거라고. 그리고 그놈들의 이름은 "블러드"서커지만 그놈들은 너의 피에만 만족하지 않아.
 
블러드서커의 촉수는 인간의 혈액이 응고되는 것을 막는 부식성 침으로 젖어있지. 심지어 이 침의 양이 많다면 인간의 장기마저도 액체화 시켜버려. 블러드서커놈들은 네가 틈만 보인다면 껍질만 남아 바람만 불어도 날아갈 정도까지 말려버릴거야.
 
이미 그것만으로도 나쁘지만, 그놈들은 가끔 무리를 지어서 사냥을 하기도 해. 그런 경우에 그놈들은 정신적인 전투를 벌이지. 그놈들이 먹이를 둘러싸고 실제로 몇 놈들이 있는지 속인다음 번갈아 가면서 네 육즙을 간식으로 먹는 동안 너는 압도될거야. 난 그런방식으로 블러드서커가 먹잇감을 미치게하고 심지어 자살까지 하게 하는 걸 보았지.
 
블러드서커를 상대하는 가장 좋은 방법은 침착하고, 그놈들이 예측가능한 경로를 통해 접근하기를 유도한 다음 벌을 주라고.

Burers. Christ, you can bet your backside I haven't forgotten about Burers. They love dwelling in dark, empty places - especially laboratories or old factory complexes.
 
I was wandering around in the Meadow back when I was a much younger lad, with two burly stalkers. One of them - Zest - was dressed head to toe in the best armour money could buy at the time. The other guy, Shawl, stuck to a simple overcoat over a SEVA suit.
 
We were trying to track down a potential snork lair, only for Shawl to stop and ask, "What's that? Do you hear that?"
 
He had good ears. It was a very faint sound, but you could barely make out the noise of an infant in tears.
 
Now, even then, none of us were heartless bastards, so off we went to try to find the child. A lot of stalkers think it's only men who get into the Zone, but once in a blue moon I'll meet a woman going around, doing stalker things like anyone else - that said, full-body armour doesn't let you keep a feminine appearance, and everyone uses a false name, but I digress.
 
The point is that children do sometimes happen here. But, as is the nature of the Zone, it's extremely rare and doesn't tend to end happily - the few stalkers who find someone to start a family with usually have enough sense to leave the Zone before getting it on - like Nimble and his wife, although I hear Nimble is back now - but not everyone who survives here has common sense, and others simply have their circumstances forced on them.
 
Anyways, for those who start their whole family right in the Zone, all it takes is one stroke of bad luck to leave the babe an orphan. A second stroke and it becomes Bloodsucker food.
 
So, we had to find the child before anything else did.
 
We get to the factory complex near the Meadow, and what do we find? A black sack in the corner. "So!" we think, "That's where the sobbing was coming from".
 
Zest nods to us then steps forward. He goes to retrieve the sack, but the damn thing turns itself around, and we see it wasn't a sack at all. It was a filthy, black overcoat. And the thing wearing it was no damn baby.
 
It kept weeping, making that sick, gurgling baby sound, then raised its hands and let out a roar that almost split my skull. I could barely stand. Everything suddenly felt so heavy. My coat felt like a sheet of tiles, my gun felt like a cinderblock. An invisible force tore it out of my hands and threw it into the dark of the factory.
 
Zest had it worse. He started squishing, crumpling like a goddamn tin can underneath an invisible boot. He began screaming, his armour just got heavier, tighter, until... I don't even want to say what it looked like. There was no saving him after that.
 
Shawl was struggling, just like I was, but at least he was still alive.
 
I don't want to relive the whole ordeal to the end, but I can share a few things we learned about Burers from that encounter. Firstly, they don't like being flashed by sudden, bright lights. Secondly, they use the weight of your gear against you - their natural telekinesis becomes a special bitch when Newton gets involved. Thirdly, it takes effort for them to do this. When they tire out, when their hold falters, that's when you spring into action and gut them with your blade.

Yeah, let me tell you a story about Controllers - also known as Illusionists, among some stalkers.
 
I was working under Sakharov at the time. Well, not directly. I was working for his assistant, Professor Kruglov. He specialized in mutant studies, and I was interested to hear what kind of things he'd have to say to someone like me.
 
As it turned out, he had a whole team of assistants out in the Darkscape, only they hadn't managed to contact him in over a week, and he was starting to get suspicious. So he sent me to go track them down, make sure they're still breathing.
 
Well, they were still breathing.
 
They were fooling around in some bridge-tunnel, walking about in the nude. I thought maybe they got stuck up real bad by some bandits. Or maybe that these young nerds were feeling a little - eheh - experimental.
 
But no, the real reason was much worse, but I didn't know better back then .
 
There were around five of these eggheads. I kept myself hidden, to discern what the hell was going on.
 
Well, one of them suddenly tore their own throat out. The other smacked his head against the wall until it cracked like a nut. The third guy - who was supposed to be some sort of guard - he just... gun in his mouth and...
 
Yeah.
 
The last two just stood there as the Controller finally stepped out of the shadows of his cavernous lair - I later found records, left by this confused team, that paint a gruesome picture, where these bright young men slowly started losing their minds, getting headaches, sweating profusely. Their senses were toyed with until they had no sense left, just rambling around gormlessly, exposed to the elements. This is why our surviving couple just stood there as the damn monster broke their arms, then their legs - well, they weren't standing after that. They didn't even scream. They just lay there. The Illusionist went back to start sinking his teeth into their dead friends, and they didn't even care, they only...
 
Mm. No.
 
 I tried to save them, but I couldn't get close enough to the Controller with my shotgun without this sweet voice in my ear, urging me to drop my weapon and quietly surrender myself. I wanted to listen. I craved to obey. I had to back off and take cover before I wound up like those damn scientists.
 
In the end, I just tossed in a grenade - the Controller may be a master of telepathic manipulation and a terrifying opponent when his attention is on you, but they're too slow to dodge even the most telegraphed pineapple throw.
 
Better yet, the worst of their powers can't happen if they can't see you. Grenades don't need line of sight.
 
And that's all you really need to know to kill a Controller. This was all before psy-block, or any meaningful psychic defences had been manufactured.
 \Nowadays, you have more ways to defend yourself from them, but even so, they are no joke. They can slowly erode your will over days, or boil your brain out in a second, depending on whether they want you to serve them or whether they want to eat you. And, as the story with the eggheads demonstrate, the categories sometimes mix. So, do you have any vodka? I could sure do with some right about now.

Well, I don't really have a story this time, but something I often heard around my campfires for a while were stalkers complaining endlessly about cats. I don't blame them. These creatures used to be rare - almost unheard of, with only inveterate mutant hunters like Duty or yours truly encountering them with any regularity.
 
Back in the day, they were just mutated cats. Sure, they were still about the size of a lynx and had grossly large thyroids, but they were docile enough compared to most things in the Zone. Once upon a time, they'd do all they could to stay away from humans.
 
Oh, how things change. Some evil spirit seems to have gotten into them - sometime after 2012 they became vicious, bold. They can even be deadlier than pseudodogs! The only consolation is that cats tend to come in smaller groups.

A lot of stalkers believe in all kinds of paranormal nonsense and superstition, so it should be no surprise that one of the Zone's stranger mutants is known as the Poltergeist. What else would you call a translucent orb of light and energy that throws objects at you and generally gets up to mischief?
 
It doesn't matter what you believe in - deities, your leaders, your own energy, aliens, whatever. Poltergeists are very real. Maybe you laugh now, but it's best to be aware - not all the stories about them are true. Physical attacks like bullets will kill them quite readily, although you'll battle to hit them with a blade. But, for the love of God, don't try to throw grenades at them. They're masters of telekinesis, and they're quick bastards too - it's just a bad idea. Folklore that says you can kill them with salt, prayer or exorcisms are, unfortunately, misleading, and more than a few hunters have died trying to prove otherwise.
 
The real trick to taking these buggers out is through motion. The slower you move, the calmer your actions, the less likely it is to see you. In this way, it's incredibly easy to avoid a poltergeist if there's nothing else around.
 
Otherwise, they'll pelt you with objects. Or maybe incinerate you by conjuring burner anomalies out of thin air. Luckily, you can tell what they're likely to do by the colour they glow. Bluish poltergeists are telekinetic, orange ones tend to be pyrokinetic. I've occasionally come across dark ones... those are alright as long as you don't let them touch you. They're fatal otherwise.
 
But, whatever you do, keep a firm hold on your gear. The last thing you want is to have your knife yanked out of your hands by an invisible force, only to be slowly bled to death with it. Once they have something like that, all it takes is a little cut here, another one there, until blood starts draining out of you like a colander.

I remember, back in my rookie days, there'd be hushed talks of tall, slender abominations that skulk through the night. These creatures made for popular campfire stories, and are called Fractures - humanoid creatures with hypertrophic arms and necks. They possess one abnormal, bucketed hand that can strike with enough force to break a person's chest. Their second hand is, thankfully, about as normal as any other human's. I've heard a lot of stories about Fractures that claim they'll try to sneak up on stalkers and ask for all kinds of nonsense, from highly specific cans of food to imported toothpaste.
 
According to those myths, if you're unlucky enough not to have what it asks of you, then prepare to fight for your life. If you do have what it wants, then don't rush to hand it over; throw it on the ground away from you, move away from it quietly on all fours, and the Fracture won't harm you.
 
Well, that's what the stories say, at least. Some stalkers actually believe them, and even leave provisions in places where Fractures have been seen, in vain hopes to drive them off. In my experience, the creatures don't ask for anything and want nothing more than to eat your flesh.
 
The parts of the stories about them sneaking up on stalkers are real, however. You never know when a Fracture could be skulking around, so it's always best to keep your eyes open. Still, they're not too difficult to deal with, but only as long as you do not underestimate the reach and power of their hypertrophied hand.

Let me tell you about one of the most physically powerful mutants the Zone has to offer: the pseudogiant. Most of them aren't much taller than a man but are many times wider. They can exert colossal force through their powerful limbs - I've seen them crush entire groups of stalkers, soldiers and mercs on their own. It's this ability that earned them their name.
 
Most stalkers never encounter one - these creatures, despite their fearsome appearance, often prefer to keep to themselves. Pseudogiants like vast caverns, tunnels and enclosed areas, typically acting fiercely protective over them. So, even the rare stalker who does see one rarely lives to talk about it afterwards. But, of course, I've seen one. And I've clearly lived to tell about it.
 
It brings me no peace to think that they all come from labs. The monsters all look like someone took the bodies of several men - who knows, maybe women and children too - and melted them together. Aside from their two powerful, grotesque limbs, they often have a bunch of vestigial ones sticking out all over the place. And if you see the vestigial limbs up close, you'll know what I'm talking about.
 
I think pseudogiants are the result of an experiment done by sick freaks, and the sooner they all get put out of their misery, the better. I can't imagine anyone wanting to live the way they do.
 
Speaking of putting them out of their misery - it's always best to bring explosives. Sometimes you're lucky, and the Pseudogiant is wandering the surface, in which case you can leisurely pick at it from a distance. Although this will likely use up most of your shots, it certainly is safer compared to the usual method.
 
But in its natural habitat - which doesn't include wide, open vistas - you won't have that luxury. Without explosives, you'll find its skin is too thick. At close-to-medium distances, it'll make its way to you and flatten you into a pancake long before you would've landed a lethal shot. In those cases, it's best just to run, live and prepare to come back another day.

Hmmm... I reckon I could share some of my knowledge on chimeras. A nocturnal predator, this creature is easily one of the Zone's best hunters. How so? With four legs and two heads, it is almost impossible to surprise, and difficult to outrun. It is a master of ambush, startling stalkers by pouncing them from scores of meters away and inducing fear with its stunning roar. While it might not be as robust nor as brutally powerful as a pseudogiant, it's quicker, smarter and utterly relentless, with claws and fangs that can shred through the most robust protection.
 
This knowledge wasn't easily won, however.
 
After all, that's how my mate Fox died. He was out hunting with his best friend, Trapper - when a Chimera caught them unawares. The harsh twist is that they were actively tracking that beast, and it still got the better of them. Even Gonta lost a friend or two to such accidents, although I hear it's because one of his mates turned out to be a coward.
 
They really are such vicious predators. It's best not to go out at night in the north of the Zone because of them, and if you do ever take it upon yourself to hunt one, keep your eyes and ears open, and make sure you keep your friends' asses covered.
 
Hm, what else can I tell you? Ah! As quick as these beasts are, they turn a lot slower than we do. They don't like spaces with lots of corners, but a deft hunter with a shotgun or grenades does. Another method is to keep an anomaly - preferably a burner, electro or whirligig - between yourself and the beast. If you're dealing with an arrogant specimen, it'll try to leap right through the anomaly to get to you. This won't always kill the beast, but it'll go a long way to giving you the edge you need.

I'm sure you've seen plenty of boars and fleshes around here. They're one of the more readily consumed mutants around these parts, as most of the stalkers here are much more comfortable eating mutated bacon as opposed to mutated dog. Of course, not everyone can afford to be so picky with what they put in their mouths.
 
When it comes to hunting these creatures, there's a specific trick to it. Fleshes tend to be cowardly, so it's tricky to get close without trapping it first. For this, it's best to step softly and then unload with a shotgun once you're sure you can get most of the pellets where they need to go. One or two clean shots should do it. When the rest of the herd scatters, don't chase them into anomalies, as that wastes the meat.
 
For boars... well that's another story. Boars have thick bones protecting their teeny, tiny brains, and unlike the Flesh, the Zone's mutations have made them hyper-aggressive. Once they see you, they'll charge. I've seen so many stalkers foolishly try to gun one down once it starts charging, thinking they'd kill it before it reached them. Nope, nope, nope. Every last one of those fools died painfully, their entrails torn out by savage tusks.
 
 With boars, you need to play the matador. The wild pigs can't exactly turn on a dime, so use corners and clever footwork to sidestep it. From there, you can either shoot it in the side, or you can grab an axe and hack at it. If you're on a budget, I recommend using an axe and making it quick.
 
 I wouldn't overdo it, however. We aren't the only ones who eat these creatures, and overhunting them inevitably leads to far deadlier mutants raiding stalker camps for new sources of sustenance. I mean, knock yourself out if you wish to hunt them. Just know when to stop.

Yeah, let me show you what I've jotted down about Karliks. This rare mutant chiefly resides in underground complexes, particularly the ones which were used for human experimentation before the Zone's birth. Presumably, Karliks were the outcome of such tests. While they do share remarkably similar physical properties with Burers, they don't seem to be able to use telekineses. Instead, the malicious buggers just run up to you and strike with their bare hands. There's a method to that madness, however, as they possess a highly potent psy-aura that can really scramble your brain if you let them stay too close.\n \nOverall, you don't need to worry about them too much as they're not that dangerous if you're fully awake. Just don't slow yourself down with the hysterical laughter you might have when you see Karliks run around on their little legs. Yes, it's happened before...
I think you should go out and make your own story for a while. I'm done for the moment.
What kind of place is this?

This, fellow stalker, is the flea market. Lots of diggers and small-time traders pawn off old wares as they pass through here. In truth, most of it is pretty garbage, but on special nights we get some real gems coming through, so we make do. So, do you have anything you want to sell?
What are your experiences with the other stalkers around here?

What kind of question is that? This is the Garbage. All sorts of people come through these parts. Some are stalkers who want to be traders. Some of them even have some pretty nice stuff to sell. Others are bandits, mercs, even military. Sometimes we get along, sometimes there's a fight. That's why we have guards around.
 
Others are Duty. Now, don't get me wrong, Duty soldiers tend to be upright guys individually, but get enough of them into a group, and I swear they become more fanatical than even the Monolith.
 
Overall, we have mixed, colourful experiences with the different groups around here. As long as they don't disrupt the little market we have here though, we'll get along just fine.
